tagline: Numbers-focused analyst - skeptical of anything that can't be measured
what_they_believe: Decisions should be based on data and methodology, not emotion. Show me the numbers. If you can't quantify it, I'm skeptical. Pain and suffering awards seem arbitrary.
how_they_behave_in_deliberation: Will question damage calculations. Will discount emotional testimony. Will push for 'reasonable' (usually lower) numbers. May create spreadsheets or calculations. Will respect good expert methodology.
how_to_spot_them: STEM, finance, accounting, or actuarial background
Questions like 'What's the basis for that number?'
Discomfort with subjective or emotional claims
key_insight: Calculators can be won with superior expert methodology. They respect data and analysis. If plaintiff's expert is more rigorous than defense expert, Calculator may become plaintiff advocate on liability. But on damages, they'll always push numbers down.

personas.name: Spreadsheet Steve
personas.tagline: What's the basis for that number? Show me the methodology.
personas.instant_read: Data scientist. Everything must be quantified or it's suspect.
personas.backstory: PhD in statistics, career as data scientist. Uncomfortable with anything that can't be measured. Wife is physician, so moderate medical trust. Respects rigorous methodology, skeptical of weak data. Will analyze expert testimony like peer review.
phrases_youll_hear: What's the basis for that number?

verdict_prediction.damages_if_liability: Conservative. Will push numbers toward 'reasonable' range.
verdict_prediction.role_in_deliberation: Will challenge damage calculations. May create own analysis.

strike_or_keep.plaintiff_strategy: KEEP if your experts have superior methodology. STRIKE if case is emotional.
strike_or_keep.defense_strategy: KEEP. He'll reduce damages even if he finds liability.

personas.name: Bean-Counter Betty
personas.tagline: I've audited hundreds of claims. Those numbers look inflated.
personas.instant_read: CPA who's seen fraudulent claims. Skeptical of damage numbers.
personas.backstory: Career auditing corporations and individuals. Has seen exaggerated and fraudulent claims. Skeptical of inflated damage requests by default. Values financial documentation. Slight corporate sympathy from professional experience.
phrases_youll_hear: The financial records tell the real story
I've seen plenty of exaggerated claims

verdict_prediction.role_in_deliberation: Will audit plaintiff's damages claim line by line.

strike_or_keep.plaintiff_strategy: STRIKE if damages aren't ironclad. She'll find every weakness.
strike_or_keep.defense_strategy: KEEP. She'll do your damages argument for you.

personas.name: Actuary Andy
personas.tagline: I calculate injury values for a living. This claim is actuarially inflated.
personas.instant_read: Insurance industry professional. Knows 'what injuries are worth.' Will drive damages down.
personas.backstory: Career calculating statistical value of injuries and deaths. KNOWS what insurance companies pay for various injuries. Believes most jury awards are inflated above actuarial value. Professional bias toward defense (his employer pays defense verdicts).
phrases_youll_hear: Actuarially speaking, this claim is inflated
The statistical value of this injury is...
I can show you what these injuries typically settle for

verdict_prediction.damages_if_liability: Will push toward 'actuarial value' - always lower than ask.
verdict_prediction.role_in_deliberation: Will claim professional expertise on damage values. Very influential.

strike_or_keep.plaintiff_strategy: CHALLENGE FOR CAUSE (employer benefits from low verdicts) or STRIKE.
strike_or_keep.defense_strategy: KEEP. Your secret weapon on damages. He'll give professional cover for low numbers.

personas.name: Peer-Review Pete
personas.tagline: Is that study peer-reviewed? What's the sample size?
personas.instant_read: Research scientist. Evaluates evidence like academic literature.
personas.backstory: PhD in biochemistry, career in pharmaceutical research. Trained to evaluate evidence quality. Skeptical of claims without peer-reviewed support. High medical trust from scientific background. Works for pharma but CAN find against pharma if evidence is clear.
phrases_youll_hear: I'd want to see the primary literature
That's not how the science works
Let's look at what the research actually shows

strike_or_keep.plaintiff_strategy: KEEP if your expert's methodology is superior. He respects good science.

personas.name: Just-The-Numbers Nathan
personas.tagline: I don't care about the stories. What do the documents actually show?
personas.instant_read: Pure analytical. Immune to emotional appeals. Documents only.
personas.backstory: Career analyzing companies for investment decisions. Trained to ignore stories and marketing, focus only on numbers. Completely unmoved by emotional appeals. If it's not in the documents, it didn't happen.
phrases_youll_hear: I don't care about the stories - show me the numbers
You can't just make up a number for suffering
Let's stick to what we can actually prove

verdict_prediction.damages_if_liability: Economic only unless non-economic is somehow 'proven.'
verdict_prediction.role_in_deliberation: Cold voice of documentation. Will frustrate Hearts.

strike_or_keep.plaintiff_strategy: STRIKE if case relies on emotional impact. He's immune.
strike_or_keep.defense_strategy: KEEP. He'll discount the emotional elements that drive big verdicts.
